description: "With assistance from Blessing Chiripanhura, Jean Grugel, and Ben Thirkell-White.", Poor people everywhere are politically weak, and yet poverty in some developing countries has gone down dramatically. Why is this? Using nine country case-studies this book provides answers by examining government alliances; policies on labour, tax, and expenditure; and the role of aid donors and NGOs.
title: The Politics of Poverty Reduction, The Politics of Poverty Reduction
